name: toolbar
description: A toolbar displays a strip of control elements such as buttons and menu buttons, often grouped by separators.

spacing.description: Specifies the spacing between content. 'sm' spacing is recommended for button variants that don't have a background or border, for example borderless buttons. 'lg' spacing is recommended for button variants that have a background or border, for example outlined or solid buttons.

chroming.description: Specifies the chroming to be set on content to be placed into the toolbar.

size.description: Specifies the size of content to be placed into the toolbar.

items.description: Specifies the content to be placed into the toolbar.

exceptionStatus.description: Stop 'items' property test adapter generation based upon metadata, and instead use override to freeze the API.

type.description: Specifies the type of the toolbar item.

chroming.description: Indicates in what states the item has variants in background and border.

solid.description: Valid for Button, Menu Button, Split Menu Button, and Progress Button items.

borderless.description: Valid for Button, Menu Button, Buttonset, Toggle Button, and Progress Button items.

outlined.description: Valid for Button, Menu Button, Split Menu Button, Buttonset, Toggle Button, and Progress Button items.

ghost.description: Valid for Button and Menu Button items.

callToAction.description: Valid for Button, Split Menu Button, and Progress Button items.

disabled.description: Specifies whether the item should be disabled.

display.description: Display just the labels, the icons, or all (not supported for Split Menu Button items).

endIcon.description: Optional icon to show at the end position of an item (not supported for Split Menu Button nor Buttonset items).

isLoading.description: Specifies if progress should be shown (only valid for Progress Button items).

items.description: Specifies the content for Menu Button, Split Menu Button, and Buttonset items. See the Help documentation for more information.

disabled.description: Specifies if the menu item or buttonset toggle item is disabled.

endIcon.description: Optional icon to show at the end position of a top-level menu item or of a buttonset toggle item (not supported for submenu items).

items.description: Specifies submenu or select menu content. See the Help documentation for more information.

key.description: A unique key associated with the menu item.

label.description: Text to show in the menu item or the buttonset toggle item.

onAction.description: An optional callback function associated with a top-level menu item (not supported for submenu items).

startIcon.description: Optional icon to show at the start position of a top-level menu item or a buttonset toggle item (not supported for submenu items).

type.description: Specifies the type of the menu item (not supported for buttonset toggle items).

value.description: The value associated with a buttonset toggle item (not supported for menu items).

variant.description: Specifies the behavior of a top-level menu item (not supported for submenu items nor buttonset toggle items).

key.description: A unique key associated with the item (not supported for Menu Button items, and required for all other items).

label.description: Text to show in the item (not supported for Buttonset items, and required for all other items).

onAction.description: A callback function associated with the item (only valid for Button, Split Menu Button, and Progress Button items).

startIcon.description: Optional icon to show at the start position of an item (not supported for Split Menu Button nor Buttonset items).

suffix.description: Optional suffix appended to menu label to indicate last selection (only valid for Menu Button items).

tooltip.description: Optional override text for the default tooltip that renders the label when in icon mode (not supported for Buttonset items).

toolbarSelection.description: An array containing key/value objects for selection groups.

ojToolbarAction.description: Triggered when a toolbar item is clicked, whether by keyboard, mouse, or touch events. Detail indicates which toolbar item was clicked.

ojToolbarSelection.description: Triggered when a toolbar selection group item is clicked, whether by keyboard, mouse, or touch events. Detail indicates new selection value for group.

setProperty.description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.
